metadata.title: CVE-2024-26705 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: parisc:BTLB: Fix crash when setting up BTLB at CPU bringup When using hotplug andbringing up a 32-bit CPU, ask the firmware about the BTLB information toset up the static (block) TLB entries. For that write access to the staticbtlb_info struct is needed, but since it is marked __ro_after_init thekernel segfaults with missing write permissions. Fix the crash by droppingthe __ro_after_init annotation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26705` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
